attributes.action: Introduce Civic lessons in schools to help foreigners to adapt to our society
attributes.additional_details: I think the society will benefit from this initiative in the years to come. I also think that while multiculturalism have its own benefits, British culture with its moral and civic values must be understood and respected by anyone who lives in the UK
attributes.background: I think it’ll be a good idea to introduce Civic lessons in schools curriculum as this would help younger generations to learn how they should act as a member of our society. Also it’ll be a great opportunity for the foreign students to learn our society’s values in order to act in respect of them.

rejection.details:
Citizenship education is already a mandatory subject for pupils aged 11-16 in maintained schools in England.

You can read more about this here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/national-curriculum-in-england-citizenship-programmes-of-study
